title: On running in new cities
body: There's a particular kind of knowledge you get from running through a city you've never been to. It's not the knowledge of a tourist â€” you don't see monuments or take photos. You see the cracks in the sidewalk, the dogs being walked, the bakeries opening at 6am. You learn the city the way a local knows it: through your feet.

title: Things I keep on my shelf
body: I started collecting objects that remind me of ideas. A compass for when I feel lost. An hourglass for when I'm impatient. A key for when I need to unlock something in myself. They sit on my shelf and they remind me, quietly, of the things I already know but keep forgetting.

title: Morning routines are overrated
body: Every productivity blog wants you to wake up at 5am, meditate, journal, exercise, and eat a perfect breakfast. I just want to drink my coffee slowly and look out the window. Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is nothing at all.
